title: regression: cannot subclasss x509.general_name.OtherName

labels.name: waiting-on-reporter
labels.description: Issue is waiting on a reply from the reporter. It will be automatically cloesd if there is no reply.

body:
Prior to #6423, it was possible (unsure if this was intentional or not), to subclass `OtherName` to create custom OID types.

We have a subclass of `OtherName` that makes dealing with UPNs (User Principle Name) that are encoded in client certificates easier to deal with with less boilerplate.
It looks something like this
```py
class UPN(x509.general_name.OtherName):
    """UPN OID for Cryptography"""

    def __init__(self, value: str | bytes):
        if isinstance(value, str):
            value = encoder.encode(value, asn1Spec=char.UTF8String())
        super(UPN, self).__init__(MS_UPN_OID, value)
        if isinstance(value, bytes):
            name = str(decoder.decode(value, asn1Spec=char.UTF8String())[0])
        else:
            name = value
        self.name = name
```

The PR mentioned earlier ported the encoding of general names from Python to Rust.
In doing so, an `isinstance(o, OtherName)` check was effectively turned the encoding check to `type(o) is OtherName`.
This means you can't encode any subclasses of OtherName names anymore!

This feels like a regression to me :/

A workaround to make this work again is below, but this feels subpar.
```
def _make_upn(value: str):
    upn = UPN(value)
    return x509.general_name.OtherName(upn.type_id, upn.value)
```
